p: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is a lentivirus (a subgroup of retrovirus) that causes HIV infection and over time acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). HIV is a virus spread through certain body fluids that kills or impairs cells of the immune system, specifically the CD4 T cells, and progressively destroys the bodyâ€™s ability to fight infections and certain cancers (German Advisory Committee Blood 2016).
